newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine's Kuchma names three new ministers. [CORRECTED 18:33 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Ukraine's Kuchma names three new ministers. [CORRECTED 18:33 GMT]

text.p: Ukrainian President Leonid Kuchma on Wednesday named Ihor Mityukov, a former deputy prime minister (corrects) and currently envoy to the European Union, as finance minister, the presidential press office said.
At the same time Yuri Yekhanurov, Chairman of the State
Property Fund, was put in charge of the economy ministry to replace Vasyl Hureyev, who became minister for machine-building and the military complex, a statement said.
Analysts said the moves were designed to protect Prime Minister Pavlo Lazarenko's position amid criticism of the government.

The previous finance minister, Valentyn Koronevsky, was dismissed by Kuchma on Tuesday for "serious inadequacies in his work." Statistics minister Olexander Osaulenko was also sacked, accused of bad management.
The statement said outgoing machine-building minister Valery Maleyev was being moved to another post but did not say what his new job would be.

The changes were made against a background of economic troubles which have sparked criticism from across the political spectrum and brought miners, teachers and other workers on to the streets in protest in recent months.
